title: Boeing warns new defect on 787 Dreamliners will slow deliveries
description: Boeing said the issue isn't related to flight safety and that 787 Dreamliner planes in service can continue operating.

title: Apple's next challenge: It needs apps for its Vision Pro headset, but it's not on sale yet
description: Apple somehow needs to convince developers to make apps for it even though the hardware isn't widely available yet.

title: I tried the Apple Vision Pro mixed-reality headset — here's what it's like
description: Apple's Vision Pro is a massive improvement over other virtual- or mixed-reality headsets, with sharp displays and an impressive surround sound audio system.

title: GitLab shares rocket 33% as software vendor boosts forecast, announces generative A.I. plans
description: GitLab beat on the top and bottom lines and increased its full-year guidance after raising the price of its premium subscription.

title: PGA Tour agrees to merge with Saudi-backed rival LIV Golf
description: The PGA Tour is merging with Saudi-backed rival LIV Golf, following months of tensions and mounting lawsuits between the competitors.

title: World Bank sees major economies growing at much slower pace thanks to higher rates and banking stress
description: Growth forecasts for advanced economies project just 0.7% increase this year, down from 2.6% estimated growth in 2022.

title: Sequoia Capital to split into three parts, separating its China and India businesses
description: The global venture capital firm said it had become increasingly complex to run a global business, and that the split would be completed by March 2024.

title: SEC sues Coinbase over exchange and staking programs, stock drops 16%
description: The U.S. securities regulator alleged that the exchange was offering 13 different assets that were considered securities and operating as a broker and exchange.

title: Chip giant Arm snubbed London for a NY listing. But the London Stock Exchange hasn't given up hope
description: London Stock ExchangeCEO Julia Hoggett said there had been "strong appetite from investors in the U.K. for Arm."

title: Destroyed Ukrainian dam unleashes floodwaters, putting thousands at risk: Here’s what we know so far
description: The damage to the dam has raised fears about safety, water supply, and Europe's largest nuclear power plant.

title: Apple's entry into VR with its new headset is a 'watershed moment,' say top industry execs
description: Cher Wang, Taiwanese tech giant HTC's CEO, told CNBC that she sees Apple's move as a validation for the industry, calling it a "watershed moment."

title: CNBC Daily Open: Apple failed to impress
description: Apple's augmented-reality headset promises to make apps three-dimensional. But the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite was essentially flat in response.

title: Australia's central bank hikes rates by 25 basis points, defies expectations
description: Economists polled by Reuters were widely expecting the central bank to hold its rates steady.

title: Brace for disruption — but A.I. won't eliminate jobs completely, says Singapore's deputy prime minister
description: Singapore's deputy prime minister Lawrence Wong does not believe technology will eliminate jobs completely.

title: European startup funding to drop a further 39% this year as tech rout continues
description: Funding for Europe's venture-backed startups is forecast to decline from $83 billion in 2022 to $51 billion in 2023, Atomico said.

title: El Nino is approaching and your next cup of coffee could be at risk
description: Extreme weather conditions due to El Nino are fueling concerns that robusta coffee beans in major producers like Vietnam and Indonesia could be hit.

title: West Coast port labor issues persist from Los Angeles to Seattle, with supply chain frustration mounting
description: Union labor issues at West Coast ports continued Monday, with fears of wider disruption to logistics and trucking companies during peak shipping season.

title: Don't underestimate China's ability to build its own advanced chips despite U.S. curbs, tech analysts say
description: Analysts are optimistic that Chinese chip makers will find workarounds despite Washington's attempts to cut China off from advanced chip tech.

title: Japan's yen is weakening again, prompting talk of another intervention worth billions of dollars
description: The Bank of Japan's next monetary policy meeting is scheduled to be held on June 15 and 16.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Apple fails to impress
description: Apple's augmented-reality headset promises to make apps three-dimensional. But the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite was essentially flat in response.
